thread.title: A Guide to 13 Essential Nashville Dive Bars
thread.title_full: A Guide to 13 Essential Nashville Dive Bars

author: Kristy Lucero
title: A Guide to 13 Essential Nashville Dive Bars

organizations.name: essential nashville dive bars all facebook/springwater supper club & lounge

text:
A Guide to 13 Essential Nashville Dive Bars All Facebook/Springwater Supper Club & Lounge There is certainly no shortage of bars in Nashville. Of course there’s the strip of honky-tonks on Broadway that Nashville is known for—but beyond the neon signs and country music is a radius housing some of the most laid-back and often grungy dive bars around. So where do you go when you need a cheap drink and a place to relax for a couple of hours? Check out these 13 essential Nashville dive bars. For this update we say farewell to downtown haunt Riverfront Tavern , which recently closed its doors. And we welcome back Melrose Billiard Parlor , which reopened at the end of December under new ownership and with a few upgrades. Did we miss your favorite? Is there an egregious omission? Take to the comments and make your opinion known! Listed in geographical order, north to south. 1 Turn One 
A neighborhood sports bar boasting $2.25 beers, pool tables and karaoke, Turn One Bar in East Nashville is as dive-y as they come.
